Call, email or submit an inquiry today to learn more! 98 Broad Street, Charleston, SC 29401 map marker pin Our Mission Is To provide fresh, affordable, healthy, global cuisine with French flair in a social environment that encourages community and the Arts. Private Parties Whatever the occasion, our tailored service will bring your vision to life. Search no more we have a perfect place for you! parties book now About Us Gaulart & Maliclet French Café opened its door during the summer of 1984 in Charleston, SC by artists Gwylene Gallimard & Jean-Marie Mauclet as a tool to build community through food. They remain advisors to the longtime employees that carry on their legacy. The shared tables that bring the height of the customer to the same height of the staff, the open kitchen, the focus on simple, fresh ingredients and our commitment to making fresh soups and specials daily are just as important today as they were when we opened. Charleston continues to expand outward and change demographically but the Café remains a place where people of all walks of life can gather, communicate, and enjoy a home cooked meal and an affordable glass of French Wine! our menu food menu Gallery Reviews review by - Yelp Marty M: Have visited this great place for over 20 years, always outstanding. Be warned it is small, no reservations, friendly helpful staff and food that is delightful. My favorite lunch place in Charleston! review by - Yelp Shawna W: Great service and excellent food. We were in from out of town and needed a quick bite to eat after walking all over all day. We were seated right away and our server popped right over. The food was delicious and quick. Definitely recommend! review by - Yelp Nicolas A: Great place to eat! Their logo doesn't lie -Fast and French- because it really is. Food is amazing especially for the low price you're paying. I always order take out so don't know how to service is, but just based off the food, its spectacular! review by - Yelp David Q: This place is a hidden gem and known as a locals spot. We go to this place at least once a week. You can't find a better deal in downtown and the staff is always amazing. Specials change daily and then they have a rotating ethic cuisine weekly special. These reasons keep us coming back over and over. review by - Yelp Sarah B: Gaulart & Maliclet is the best local eatery in Charleston. The menu features authentic French cuisine that is fresh and delicious. I've never had a bad meal here and it is the one restaurant I make sure to visit every time I come to town...
